statements.name: PROC DS2
statements.description: Specifies that the subsequent input is DS2 language statements.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Controls the operation of a MERGE or SET statement in a DS2 program and sets up special grouping variables.

statements.name: CONTINUE
statements.description: Stops processing the current DO loop iteration and resumes with the next iteration.

statements.name: DATA
statements.description: Begins a DS2 program and provides names for any output tables.

statements.name: DECLARE
statements.description: Declares one or more DS2 variables or temporary arrays.
statements.help:
DECLARE [PRIVATE] { <data-type> <variable-list> [ <having-clause> ] } ;
< data-type >::= 
	<exact-numeric-type> |                     <approximate-numeric-type> | <binary-string-type> |                     <string-type> 
		| <date-type>

	<exact-numeric-type> ::= 
		                             {INT  | BIGINT  |                             SMALLINT  | TINYINT 
			 |                             DECIMAL [(precision 
       [,scale] )] |                             NUMERIC [(precision 
       [,scale])] }

	<approximate-numeric-type> ::=
		{                             DOUBLE  | DOUBLE PRECISION  |                             FLOAT  | REAL  }

	<binary-string-type>::=
		BINARY (length)                         |                         VARBINARY (length)

	<string-type>::= 
		NCHAR [ (          character-length ) ]
		| NVARCHAR [ (          character-length ) ]
		| CHAR [ (          character-length ) ][CHARACTER SET character-set-identifier]
		| VARCHAR [ (          character-length ) ][CHARACTER SET character-set-identifier]

	<date-type>::= 
		{ TIME  |                             TIMESTAMP  }                         [ (          precision ) ] | DATE 

<variable-list>::= 
	{ variable[ ...variable] }

	| { variable                     <array-declaration>                     [variable ...<array-declaration>      ] } 
		<array-declaration>::= 
			\[                             <array-bound>                             [,  ...< array-bound>         ]                             \]                             | \[ *                             \]
		<array-bound>::= 
			{ [dim-lower:]dim-upper} | {                             [dim-lower:]                             {DIM (a[,n]) }

<having-clause>::= 
	HAVING                      <having-option> [ ... <having-option> ]
		<having-option>::= 
			LABEL                              'string' |                             n'string'
			| FORMAT format
			| INFORMAT format

statements.name: DECLARE PACKAGE
statements.description: Creates a package variable and optionally creates a package instance.

statements.name: DECLARE THREAD
statements.description: Creates an instance of a thread.

statements.name: DO
statements.description: Specifies a group of statements to be executed as a unit.
statements.help:
DO [<numeric-data-type>][index-variable =  <index-variable-clause>][ <conditional-clause> ]
[,  ...[<index-variable-clause>] [ <conditional-clause> ]];  
	 ...statement-list ...

END  [end-label] ; 
< numeric-data-type >::= 
	<exact-numeric-type> | <approximate-numeric-type> 

	<exact-numeric-type> ::=  
		 {INT  | BIGINT  | SMALLINT  | TINYINT 
			 | DECIMAL [(precision [,scale] )] | NUMERIC [(precision [,scale])] }

	<approximate-numeric-type> ::=
		{ DOUBLE  | DOUBLE PRECISION  | FLOAT  | REAL  }

<index-variable-clause>::=  
	start[TO stop[BY increment]]

<conditional-clause>::=  
	WHILE    ( expression ) | UNTIL    ( expression )

statements.name: DROP
statements.description: Excludes columns from output tables.

statements.name: DROP PACKAGE
statements.description: Deletes a DS2 package.

statements.name: DROP THREAD
statements.description: Deletes a DS2 thread program.

statements.name: DS2_OPTIONS
statements.description: Specifies or changes the default behavior of a DS2 program.

statements.name: ENDDATA
statements.description: Marks the end of a DATA statement.

statements.name: ENDPACKAGE
statements.description: Marks the end of a PACKAGE statement.

statements.name: ENDTHREAD
statements.description: Marks the end of a THREAD statement.

statements.name: FORWARD
statements.description: Indicates that the method definition follows the method expression.

statements.name: GOTO
statements.description: Transfers execution immediately to a labeled statement.

statements.name: IF
statements.description: Continues processing only those rows that meet the condition.

statements.name: IF-THEN/ELSE
statements.description: Executes a statement for rows that meet specific conditions.

statements.name: KEEP
statements.description: Includes columns in output tables.

statements.name: Labels
statements.description: Identifies a statement that is referred to by another statement.

statements.name: LEAVE
statements.description: Stops processing the current DO loop and transfers execution to either the statement following the current DO statement, or a labeled DO statement that encloses the current DO statement.

statements.name: MERGE
statements.description: Joins rows from two or more tables into a single row.

statements.name: METHOD
statements.description: Defines a block of code that can be called and executed multiple times.
statements.help:
[PRIVATE]METHOD method         ([[IN_OUT] <parameter> [,  ...
              [IN_OUT]<                   parameter>]] ) 
	[RETURNS data-type];
		 ...method-body ...
END ;
<parameter>::= 
	<data-type>           variable

< data-type >::= 
	<exact-numeric-type> |           <approximate-numeric-type> | <binary-string-type> | <string-type>           
		| <date-type>

	<exact-numeric-type> ::= 
		               {INT  | BIGINT  | SMALLINT  |               TINYINT 
			 | DECIMAL [(precision
                [,scale] )] | NUMERIC [(precision
                [,scale])] }

	<approximate-numeric-type> ::=
		{ DOUBLE  |               DOUBLE PRECISION  | FLOAT  |               REAL  }

	<binary-string-type>::=
		BINARY (length)             |             VARBINARY (length)

	<string-type>::= 
		NCHAR [ ( character-length )               ]
		| NVARCHAR [ ( character-length )               ]
		| CHAR [ ( character-length )               ][CHARACTER SET character-set-identifier]
		| VARCHAR [ ( character-length )               ][CHARACTER SET character-set-identifier]

	<date-type>::= 
		{ TIME  |               TIMESTAMP  } [ ( precision ) ] | DATE

statements.name: Null
statements.description: Creates an empty statement.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: Writes the current row to a table.

statements.name: PACKAGE
statements.description: Creates a DS2 package.

statements.name: PUT
statements.description: Prints the values of program variables, arrays, and constants to the SAS log.
statements.help:
PUT   < put-list > [ ... <put-list> ] ;  
	<put-list>::=  
		_ALL_ 
		| 'character-string'
		| ['character-string']<eq-expression> [=][[:]format[-L | -C | -R]]

	<eq-expression>::=  
		identifier
		| array-reference
		| this-expression
		| package-attribute

	<package-attribute>::=
		package-variable. package-attribute
		| package-variable ...[. package-variableN]. package-attribute

statements.name: RENAME
statements.description: Specifies new names for columns in output tables.

statements.name: RETAIN
statements.description: Specifies that all columns or all columns in the column list have their values retained between executions of the RUN method.
statements.help:
Form 1: 
RETAIN ;
Form 2: 
RETAIN column-list;
Form 3: 
RETAIN column-list < constant-value >;
Form 4: 
RETAIN column-list ( < constant-value > …  < constant-value > );< constant-value >::=  
	bit_constant

	| hex_constant

	| floating_constant

	| decimal_constant

	| sas_missing_value

	| integer_constant

	| string_constant

	| null

	| DATE character_constant

	| TIME character_constant

	| TIMESTAMP character_constant

Form 5: 
RETAIN vararray;

statements.name: RETURN
statements.description: Returns execution from a method to the method caller.

statements.name: SELECT
statements.description: Executes one of several statements or groups of statements.

statements.name: SET
statements.description: Reads rows from one or more tables.

statements.name: SET FROM
statements.description: Runs a DS2 program as one or more threads.

statements.name: STOP
statements.description: Stops execution of the current DS2 program.

statements.name: Sum
statements.description: Adds or subtracts the result of an expression to an accumulator variable.

statements.name: THREAD
statements.description: Creates a DS2 program thread.

statements.name: VARARRAY
statements.description: Declares one or more DS2 variable arrays.
statements.help:
VARARRAY  <data-type> array-name <array-declaration> [<variable-list>][<having-clause>];
< data-type >::= 
	<exact-numeric-type> | <approximate-numeric-type> | <binary-string-type> | <string-type> 
		| <date-type>

	<exact-numeric-type> ::=  
		 {INT  | BIGINT  | SMALLINT  | TINYINT 
			 | DECIMAL  [(precision [,scale] )] | NUMERIC   [(precision [,scale])] }

	<approximate-numeric-type> ::=
		{ DOUBLE  | DOUBLE PRECISION  | FLOAT  | REAL  }

	<binary-string-type>::=
		BINARY (length) | VARBINARY (length)

	<string-type>::=  
		NCHAR  [ ( character-length ) ]
		| NVARCHAR  [ ( character-length ) ]
		| CHAR  [ ( character-length ) ]  [CHARACTER SET character-set-identifier ]
		| VARCHAR  [ ( character-length ) ]  [CHARACTER SET character-set-identifier ]

	<date-type>::=  
		{ TIME  | TIMESTAMP  }  [ ( precision ) ] | DATE 

<array-declaration::=\[array-bound>[,  ...<array-bound>]\

	<array-bound>::= {[dim-lower:]dim-upper} | {[dim-lower:] {DIM(a[, n]) | *} }
<variable-list>::=  
	name-varlist | 
		| numbered-range-varlist
		|  name-range-list
		| name-prefix-list
		| type-varlist
		| special-name-list
<having-clause>::=  
	HAVING  <having-option> [… <having-option> ]  
		<having-option>::=  
			LABEL  'string' | n'string'
			| FORMAT format
			| INFORMAT format

statements.name: VARLIST
statements.description: Creates a named variable list.
